case_vignette: A 7-year-old boy is brought to the physician by his mother for the evaluation of abdominal pain and trouble sleeping for the past 6 months. His mother says he complains of crampy abdominal pain every morning on school days. He started attending a new school 7 months ago and she is concerned because he has missed school frequently due to the abdominal pain. He also has trouble falling asleep at night and asks to sleep in the same room with his parents every night. He has not had fever, vomiting, diarrhea, or weight loss. He sits very close to his mother and starts to cry when she steps out of the room to take a phone call. Abdominal examination shows no abnormalities.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having crampy stomach pains every morning, especially on school days, and I've been having trouble falling asleep at night.
How old are you?
I'm 7 years old.
Do you have any history of food allergies or intolerances?
No, I don't have any food allergies or intolerances.
Do you have any family history of gastrointestinal disorders or irritable bowel syndrome?
I'm sorry, I don't know about any family history of stomach problems or irritable bowel syndrome.
Have you been feeling anxious or stressed lately?
Yes, I've been having trouble sleeping and I get upset and start to cry when my mom leaves the room.
Do you have any other symptoms like diarrhea or constipation?
No, I haven't had any diarrhea or constipation.
Thank you. Have you experienced any recent significant changes or stressors in your life, like starting at a new school or any family changes?
Yes, I started going to a new school 7 months ago.
**Final Diagnosis:** Adjustment disorder with anxiety
